section.para:
The ngx_http_browser_module module creates variables whose values depend on the value of the User-Agent request header field:
$modern_browser
equals to the value set by the directive, if a browser was identified as modern;
$ancient_browser
equals to the value set by the directive, if a browser was identified as ancient;
$msie
equals “1” if a browser was identified as MSIE of any version.

section.name: Example Configuration

directive.name: ancient_browser
directive.para: If any of the specified substrings is found in the User-Agent request header field, a browser will be considered ancient. The special string “netscape4” corresponds to the regular expression “^Mozilla/[1-4]”.

directive.name: ancient_browser_value
directive.para: Sets a value for the $ancient_browser variables.

directive.name: modern_browser
directive.para: Specifies a version starting from which a browser is considered modern. A browser can be any one of the following: msie, gecko (browsers based on Mozilla), opera, safari, or konqueror.
Versions can be specified in the following formats: X, X.X, X.X.X, or X.X.X.X. The maximum values for each of the format are 4000, 4000.99, 4000.99.99, and 4000.99.99.99, respectively.

The special value unlisted specifies to consider a browser as modern if it was not listed by the modern_browser and directives. Otherwise such a browser is considered ancient. If a request does not provide the User-Agent field in the header, a browser is treated as not being listed.

directive.name: modern_browser_value
directive.para: Sets a value for the $modern_browser variables.
